KnowhowInfomation.KnowhowName: JNDI lookup call from inside a container of an AP server

CheckItem.CheckItemName: Search for InitialContext instance generation in java codes
CheckItem.SearchProcess: Search for calls to InitialContext with arguments in java files
CheckItem.VisualConfirm: Make it a non-porting item when there is no argument for InitialContext. Check if the code in question is a call from inside an AP server container when there are arguments specified. If it is from inside an AP server container, no argument is needed to be specified for InitialContext and modifications are required not to specify arguments. Therefore, it will be a porting item. If it is from outside an AP server container, it is not appropriate to detect it with this item. Therefore, make it a non-porting item.

KnowhowInfomation.KnowhowName: JNDI lookup call from outside a container of an AP server

CheckItem.CheckItemName: Search for the INITIAL_CONTEXT_FACTORY setting using properties
CheckItem.SearchProcess: Search for org.jnp.interfaces.NamingContextFactory in *.properties
CheckItem.VisualConfirm: If the .properties file in question is $jboss.home/conf/jndi.properties file, make it a non-porting item. Otherwise, check that the file in question is set for a JNDI call, from outside a container. If it is a call from outside a container, the content of a property needs to be changed. Therefore it will be a porting item.

CheckItem.CheckItemName: Search for the PROVIDER_URL setting using properties
CheckItem.SearchProcess: Search for jnp:// in *.properties
CheckItem.VisualConfirm: If the .properties file in question is $jboss.home/conf/jndi.properties file, make it a non-porting item. Otherwise, check that the file in question is set for a JNDI call from outside a container. If it is a call from outside a container, the content of property needs to be changed. Therefore it will be a porting item.

CheckItem.CheckItemName: Search for the URL_PKG_PREFIXES setting using properties
CheckItem.SearchProcess: If the .properties file in question is $jboss.home/conf/jndi.properties file, make it a non-porting item.
CheckItem.VisualConfirm: If the properties file in question is the $jboss.home/conf/jndi.properties file, make it a non-porting item. Otherwise, check that the file in question is set for a JNDI call from outside a container. If it is a call from outside a container, it will be a non-porting item.

CheckItem.CheckItemName: Searching for INITIAL_CONTEXT_FACTORY setting in the Java code
CheckItem.SearchProcess: Search for org.jnp.interfaces.NamingContextFactory in *.java
CheckItem.VisualConfirm: Check if the code in question is a call from outside an AP server container. If it is a call from outside an AP server container, it will be a porting item. If it is a call from inside an AP server container, it needs to be ported. Because it is wrong to check for this item, make it a non-porting item.

ns2:info.ns2:title: How to migrate the datasource setting

ns2:section.ns2:para: This book shows how to migrate the setting using a migration tool provided by IronJacamar from the JBoss Commnutiy

ns2:info.ns2:title: Create a datasource definition file using IronJacamar

ns2:section.ns2:para: Please install IronJacamar and convert a datasource setting file by consulting the procedures in the following JBoss_Enterprise_Application_Platform-6-Migration_Guide.pdf file. A datasource definition file for JBoss EAP4 is jboss.home/server/{profile}/lib/*-ds.xml. Since a datasource definition file used by a business application needs to be migrated, convert only the datasource definition file in question using the converter provided by IronJacamar
https://access.redhat.com/knowledge/docs/en-US/JBoss_Enterprise_Application_Platform/6/pdf/Migration_Guide/JBoss_Enterprise_Application_Platform-6-Migration_Guide-en-US.pdf

It is not recommended that a datasource definition file for JBoss EAP5 is used for JBoss EAP6. The datasource setting needs to be configured with management CLI based on the setting of a datasource definition file created by IronJacamar

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: If the non-tx-datasource tag is configured in a datasource definition file for JBoss EAP5, the datasource registration setting must be configured using a data-source command with management CLI.

If the local-tx-datasource or tx-datasourc tag is configured in a datasource definition file for JBoss EAP5, the datasource registration setting must be configured using a data-source command with management CLI.

ns2:section.ns2:para: Here are a table which shows the relationship between attributes of a datasource definition file and data-source/xa-data-source commands, and an example of the datasource registration setting with management CLI;

ns2:table.ns2:title: Table which shows the relationship between attributes of a datasource definition file and parameters specified by a data-source command and a xa-data-source command

ns2:row.ns2:entry: Attribute values of a datasource definition file
Parameters specified by a xa-data-source command
Required parameters for a xa-data-source command
Required parameters for a xa-data-source commnand
Required parameters for a xa-data-source command. A driver for Postgres needs to be registered beforehand.

ns2:figure.ns2:title: Example of non-XA datasource registration using a data-source command. A driver name should be specified with the form of {driver-name}, and a datasource name should be specified with the form of {datasource-name}

Example of XA datasource registration and xa-datasource-properties setting using a xa-data-source command. A driver name should be specified with the form of {driver-name}, and a datasource name should be specified with the form of {datasource-name}

ns2:section.ns2:para: Since DB server names, ports, user names, and passwords which are specified with connection-url set in a datasource definition file for JBossEAP5 can not be configured with a xa-data-source command for XA, additional settings are done for xa-datasource-properties in the normal operation of management CLI.

ns2:info.ns2:title: How to migrate a JDBC driver

ns2:section.ns2:para: For EAP4, a JDBC driver could be loaded for JBoss only by putting it under $jboss.home/server/{profile}/lib. For EAP6, a JDBC driver must be registered as a module or deployment. We show here how to register a JDBC driver for PostgesSQL in JBoss EAP6.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: Create a definition file for a JDBC driver module (module.xml)

ns2:figure.ns2:title: module.xml for a JDBC driver for PostgresSQL

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: Deploy files required to register a JDBC driver module
Create the $jboss.modules.dir/org/postgresql folder under the JBoss module directory
Register a JDBC driver module with management CLI

ns2:figure.ns2:title: Register a JDBC driver module with management CLI in JBoss EAP6. The Driver name can be specified optionally with the form of {driver-name}.

ns2:section.ns2:para: Migration of Web container setting

In JBoss EAP4, the AJP connector setting was configured with Connector tags in $jboss.home/{profile}/deploy/jboss-web.deployer/server.xml. In JBoss EAP6, the AJP connector setting is configured with management CLI

ns2:table.ns2:title: Support for AJP connector attributes in JBoss EAP4 and JBoss EAP6

ns2:row.ns2:entry: AJP connector attributes in JBoss EAP4
AJP connector attributes in JBoss EAP6
Management CLI operations in JBoss EAP6
Use the port offset function of socket bindings

/system-property=org.apache.coyote.ajp.DEFAULT_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT:add(value=EAP4のconnectionTimeout設定値) /system-property=org.apache.coyote.ajp.DEFAULT_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT:add(value=connectionTimeout setting value in EAP4)

/system-property=org.apache.catalina.connector.USE_BODY_ENCODING_FOR_QUERY_STRING:add(value=EAP4のuseBodyEncodingForURI設定値) /system-property=org.apache.catalina.connector.USE_BODY_ENCODING_FOR_QUERY_STRING:add(value=useBodyEncodingForURI setting value in EAP4)
No corresponding parameter in EAP6? (The way to set the path for a Session cookie has changed in EAP5. What about in EAP6?)

ns2:section.ns2:para: The jvmRoute setting was configured by the jvmRoute attribute of Engine tags within the server.xml file, in JBoss EAP4, but the AJP connector setting is configured with management CLI in JBoss EAP6. Although the operation set by the system properties using management CLI is mentioned, it is recommended to define the system properties

ns2:table.ns2:title: Support for AJP connector attributes in JBoss EAP4/EAP6 and management CLI when an attribute in question is configured in JBossEAP6

ns2:row.ns2:entry: Management CLI operations in JBooss EAP6
Configured by jvmRoute attributes of Engine tags in server.xml
Configured by the system property, jvmRoute

ns2:info.ns2:title: Migration of Bean session pool setting

ns2:section.ns2:para: EJB containers get Bean instances from an instance pool. Unless the instance pool setting for this Bean is configured explicitly in jboss.xml of a deployment descriptor, the default values are applied based on the setting in $jboss.home/{profile}/conf/standardjboss.xml and the size of the instance pool is determined.
This book shows how to configure a Bean instance pool using the management CLI in JBoss EAP6.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: When the instance pool tuning is not performed explicitly in the deployment descriptor, jboss.xml
When the instance pool tuning is performed explicitly in the deployment descriptor, jboss.xml

ns2:info.ns2:title: When the instance pool tuning is not performed explicitly in the deployment descriptor, jboss.xml

ns2:section.ns2:para: In JBoss EAP4, an instance pool is configured based on the following container setting in $jboss.home/{profile}/conf/standardjboss.xml. If it is not configured in standardjboss.xml, 100 is set as the maximum value of the instance pool size. Since the default maximum value of the instance pool size is 20 in EAP 6, we show here how to set the value (100) applied by default in JBoss EAP 4.

ns2:figure.ns2:title: Setting example of a SLSB default container from standardjboss.xml in JBoss EAP4

ns2:info.ns2:title: When the instance pool tuning is performed explicitly in the jboss.xml file, of a deployment descriptor

ns2:section.ns2:para: If a ”Standard Stateless SessionBean” is specified by the attribute: extends (of container-configuration tags in jboss.xml), there is a possibility that the size of a Bean instance pool has been customized by extending a ”Standard Stateful SessionBean”, in the container setting of $jboss.home/{profile}/conf/standardjboss.xml. When the size of an instance pool specific to the Bean is customized in jboss.xml like this, you need to undertake the following migration tasks.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: Register an instance pool specific to the Bean with the management CLI and configure the instance pool. The instance pool name can be specified optionally. For example, it can be specified as "CustomerServicePool" when you configure the pool for "CustomerService".

ns2:figure.ns2:title: Setting example of an instance pool in JBossEAP5 (jboss.xml)

ns2:section.ns2:para: Configure the default instance pool setting with management CLI in JBoss EAP6. If the instance pool setting is not configured explicitly in jboss-ejb3.xml, this setting will be applied to the Bean.

ns2:figure.ns2:title: Default instance pool setting of SLSB with management CLI in JBoss EAP

ns2:figure.ns2:para: If a Bean-specific instance pool is configured for EJB in JBoss EAP6, register the Bean-specific instance pool with management CLI. When you apply the pool registered here to a Bean, you need to configure the instance pool in the EJB deployment descriptor, jboss-ejb3.xml.

ns2:info.ns2:title: When the instance pool tuning is not performed explicitly in the deployment descriptor jboss.xml

ns2:section.ns2:para: In JBoss EAP4, the instance pool setting is configured based on the following container setting in $jboss.home/{profile}/conf/standardjboss.xml. If it is not configured in standardjboss.xml, 100 is set as the maximum value of instance pool size. Since the default maximum value of an instance pool is 20 in EAP 6, we show here how to set the value (100) applied by default in JBoss EAP 4.

ns2:figure.ns2:title: Setting example of an MDB default container from standardjboss.xml in JBoss EAP4

ns2:section.ns2:para: Configure the default instance pool setting by management CLI in JBoss EAP6. If the instance pool setting was not configured explicitly in jboss-ejb3.xml, this setting will be applied to the Bean.

ns2:info.ns2:title: When the instance pool tuning is performed explicitly in jboss.xml of deployment descriptor

ns2:section.ns2:para: If a ”Standard Message Driven Bean” is specified by the attribute: extends (of container-configuration tags in jboss.xml), there is a possibility that the size of a Bean instance pool is customized by extending a ”Standard Stateful SessionBean” in the container setting of $jboss.home/{profile}/conf/standardjboss.xml. When the size of a Bean instance pool is customized in jboss.xml like this, you need to do the following migration tasks.

ns2:figure.ns2:title: Setting example of an instance pool in JBossEAP5 (jboss.xml)

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: Remove all of the container-configurations tags defined in jboss.xml

Create a deployment descriptor file (jboss-ejb3.xml）and configure the instant pool reference setting for a Bean in question. A value set by bean-instance-pool-ref should be in the form of {Bean name}Pool
Register an instance pool with the management CLI. Use the value set up by bean-instance-pool-ref mentioned above for an instance pool name

ns2:section.ns2:para: If a Bean-specific instance pool is configured for EJB in JBoss EAP6, register the Bean specific instance pool through the management CLI. When you apply the pool registered here to a Bean, you need to configure the instance pool in the EJB deployment descriptor, jboss-ejb3.xml.

ns2:info.ns2:title: Migration of the EJB deployment descriptor

ns2:section.ns2:para: Migrate a deployment descriptor (jboss.xml) for JBoss EAP 4 to jboss-ejb3.xml for JBoss EAP 6. As an example, we show here how to migrate it by using a TPCW Bean used in TPCW.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: Migrate Beans and the reference setting of the Beans defined in a deployment descriptor (jboss.xml) for JBoss EAP 4

ns2:figure.ns2:title: Deployment descriptor for JBoss EAP 4 (jboss.xml of TPCW)
Deployment descriptor for JBoss EAP 6 (jboss-ejb3.xml of TPCW)

ns2:info.ns2:title: What is not recommended in Servlet 2.5

ns2:section.ns2:para: The following is a list of functions not recommended in Servlet 3.0. If one of the following APIs is used, you will need to correct it to use another API.
Interfaces not recommended
Classes not recommended
Methods not recommended
There are many others. For further details, see the following URLs

ns2:info.ns2:title: What is not recommended in Servlet 3.0

ns2:section.ns2:para: The following is a list of functions not recommended in Servlet 3.0. If any of the following APIs are used, you will need to change that API to another.
Methods not recommended

ns2:info.ns2:title: Migration of a Web deployment descriptor (jboss-web.xml)
Call from within a container of an AP server

ns2:section.ns2:para: There are several ways to configure JNDIs when you migrate to JBoss. More generic way is to put a file called "jndi.properties" in a class path on runtime and configure parameters to be read from the file. In JBossEAP4, since the jndi.properties file normally exists in the $JBOSS_CONFIG/conf folder and what is set in a file in question is read, you do not need to configure parameters on the application side for calls from a container. Likewise in JBoss EAP6, you do need to configure them explicitly. The following is a code which enables JNDI lookup

ns2:figure.ns2:title: JNDI lookup call from inside a container of an AP server

ns2:info.ns2:title: Call from the container of the AP server

ns2:section.ns2:para: JNDI lookup call from outside a container of an AP server is needed like an EJB client. When a JNDI lookup call from outside a container of an AP server is needed, you need to configure properties for arguments of InitialContext in the following way

ns2:figure.ns2:title: JNDI lookup call from inside a container of an EAP4 AP server
JNDI lookup call from inside a container of an EAP6 AP server

ns2:section.ns2:para: For EJB clients, you need to put the following property file (jboss-ejb-client.properties) in place and set the class path to it.

ns2:figure.ns2:title: jboss-ejb-client.properties

ns2:section.ns2:para: We show here how to migrate the following settings for Web cluster.

ns2:info.ns2:title: Migration of JGroup protocol stack setting

ns2:section.ns2:para: We show here how to migrate JGroup protocol stacks used for the communication among nodes when JBoss cluster is used. The JGroup protocol stack setting in JBoss EAP4 is determined by tags specified under a config tag in the web cluster jboss-service.xml file. A UDP or TCP tag can be configured.

ns2:figure.ns2:title: The JGroup protocol stack setting in JBoss EAP4 (/opt/jboss4/current/server/myserver/deploy/jboss-web-cluster.sar/META-INF/jboss-service.xml)

ns2:section.ns2:para: The JGroup protocol stack setting in JBoss EAP6 is configured with management CLI. In JBoss EAP6, UDP is set by default for Group protocol stacks (there is no need to set this manually).

We show here how to migrate the FC setting used for a JBoss cluster.The JGroup FC setting in JBoss EAP4 is determined by FC tags in the web cluster jboss-service.xml file. When FC tags are commented out, the FC setting will be invalid.

ns2:figure.ns2:title: The JGroup FC setting in JBoss EAP4 (/opt/jboss4/current/server/myserver/deploy/jboss-web-cluster.sar/META-INF/jboss-service.xml)

ns2:section.ns2:para: The JGroup FC setting in JBoss EAP6 is configured with the management CLI as follows. Since the FC setting is enabled by default in JBoss EAP6, we show here how to disable the FC setting.

ns2:figure.ns2:title: Disabling the FC setting with the management CLI in JBoss EAP6

ns2:section.ns2:para: The JBoss EAP4 replication setting information is replicated to all nodes in a cluster group, with All-to-All replication or using Budy replication. Both of the replications can be configured. In the JBoss EAP4 replication mode setting, buddyReplicationEnabled tags in jboss-service.xml of Web cluster are set to false, so by default All-to-All replication is set.

ns2:figure.ns2:title: JBoss EAP4 replication mode setting (/opt/jboss4/current/server/myserver/deploy/jboss-web-cluster.sar/META-INF/jboss-service.xml)

ns2:section.ns2:para: In the JBoss EAP6 replication mode setting, implementation of the cache function is changed from JBoss Cache to infinispan, and the replication mode is also changed. Replication mode is set by default in JBoss EAP 6, and works the same as All-to-All replication in JBoss EAP 5.
Replication mode

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: The replication information is replicated to all of the nodes in a cluster group. It works the same as All-to-All replication in JBoss EAP 5

ns2:section.ns2:para: Distribution mode

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: The new cache function deployed in JBoss EAP 6 replicates the data to only the certain nodes in a cluster group. A backup server is not specified (such as Buddy replication), and the number of data replications specified are distributed to nodes in a cluster group.

ns2:section.ns2:para: The JBoss EAP4 replication sync setting is configured by CacheMode in the jboss-service.xml file of a web cluster. In JBoss EAP6, the REPL_ASYNC attribute is set by default for asynchronous mode replication. For sync mode, you can set the REPL_SYNC attribute.

ns2:figure.ns2:title: JBoss EAP4 replication sync setting (/opt/jboss4/current/server/myserver/deploy/jboss-web-cluster.sar/META-INF/jboss-service.xml)

ns2:section.ns2:para: The JBoss EAP6 replication sync setting is configured as asynchronous, needing no configuration.
This section shows how to configure the CMP Entity Bean container setting using the management CLI in JBoss EAP6.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: When the instance pool tuning is not performed explicitly in a deployment descriptor, jboss.xml
When the instance pool tuning is performed explicitly in a deployment descriptor, jboss.xml

ns2:section.ns2:para: Unless Entity Bean CMP setting is configured explicitly in a deployment descriptor, jboss.xml, the settings for "Standard CMP 2.x EntityBean" and "Clustered CMP 2.x EntityBean" are applied by default, and the container setting is determined. This section shows how to port them in the following cases.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: When tuning for Entity Bean CMP setting is not performed explicitly in a deployment descriptor, jboss.xml
When tuning for Entity Bean CMP setting is performed explicitly in a deployment descriptor, jboss.xml
